message: AnythIing there you don't already own?
http://blog.eu.playstation.com/2011/05/16/details-of-the-welcome-back-programme-for-scee-users-2/
I guess they're worth trying if they're free. I don't have a psp but I do have all the games on the PS3 list. Nice selection for anyone who has missed any of them, though.
I don't own any of the PSP games, but I wasn't really planning on playing any of those. Oh well.
Oh, hey there, Infamous.
I'll be grabbing Dead Nation. Sure, I'm disappointed that I already have all the others, but can't deny that it's a pretty good list from which to pick.
Meh. The only game I don't have yet is Dead Nation, so I'll grab that.
Is Quest for Booty any good? I'm not sure between that and Dead Nation for my second pick.
Part of me just wants to grab WipeOut again just so I can undo that mistake I made with my first PSN account.
Hmm, that would suggest that this is indeed not the case, then.
Silly question:  How are they going to stop the (many) people with multiple PSN accounts in different regions from claiming their free games multiple times?
Most of all, I just want the store to be up again! I'm receiving the most awesome possible thing today, but it's worthless without the PS Store :/

Apparently (based on NeoGAF comments) everyone is at present barred from logging in to a PSN account tied to a different region than their physical location -- i.e. if you're in SA, you can't access a US- or UK account. It's not known yet whether this is only a temporary measure during the network restoration, or a new permanent restriction.

Ah, wait, stupid, stupid me (and NeoGAF) -- the assumption w.r.t. this new "region locking" was based on people not being able to sign in to their Japanese accounts. But of course, the Japanese PSN is still down, with its restoration at present blocked by the government.
Eh?  I don't see why a Russian mail order bride needs the PSN store?
It would suck if it *were* a permanent restriction, though, as it would mean you wouldn't be able to buy DLC for imported games.

Huh.  I do hope it's not permanent, since the German PSN is *dire*.  (I mean really, really dire.  Which is weird, what with Europe being PlayStation country.  Xbox Live, by contrast, is alive and well here.)

That said, on Sunday night I was able to access my US and UK accounts in order to reset their passwords.

Aha, *phew*.  Nonetheless, I'll check my various PSN accounts when I get home.

Also:  Then my question still stands.  What makes it even *more* relevant is that the selection of games offered in Germany differs from, say, the UK.  Note the small print in the aforelinked blog post.

From the German selection, I'd probably get Quest for Booty and … Hustle Kings, maybe.  (I'd get Infamous but it's not on the German offer.  Mind you, I *hated* the demo.)

On the PSP I'd get ModNation and… nothing else really appeals.  Everybody's Golf 2, maybe.

@ Neilan: Quest for Booty is great. It's not a full-length title with the same scope as Tools of Destruction or Crack in Time, but it's an "episode" meant to bridge the two games and should be seen as essential for anyone who's played those. It's only 3 to 4 hours long, but is consistently delightful with great dialogue and level design, and some of the most enjoyable platforming in the whole series. 

For myself, I'll probably grab WipEout again as well, since I got the Fury add-on through Dawid's game sharing. And I may as well grab ModNation for the PSP -- I played the PS3 version, and it was very enjoyable.
I do have two PSN accounts though, so Mr_V's suggestion might be worth trying.
har har :P
I own (but haven't played) Tools of Destruction. I intend to, so if Quest for Booty is good I might go for that. I read up a little on Dead Nation and it seems pretty neat though.
I enjoyed Quest for booty throughly. Dead nation is the only game I don't have on that list so I will grab that and prob quest for booty as I last got it through the game share with Hermes.
If you haven't played Tools of Destruction yet, I suggest you go for Dead Nation instead. It has fantastic presentation, some clever mechanics and is perfect for co-op.
I have US, SA, Taiwanese and Japanese PSN accounts, so I wonder if I get free stuff on all those accounts! :D
Mmm, just checked, wasn't able to connect with any of my accounts. :( Updated my firmware yesterday, but no dice. :(
I forgot to mention that I'll be grabbing Dead Nation and Little Big Planet on PSP. Got the rest.

I'm looking at grabbing Wipeout HD as I got that via ZAnimus and bought Fury thereafter... yes, I know I've got the game on a disc, but it needs to be on my HDD like it was originally intended. Also, there is never enough Wipeout. Never!
Also, ZAnimus, you don't have to keep the redeem code a secret :)
Great! So, yeah, my Russian mail order bride is actually inFamous 2. So very very excited!
Not for us average plebians, only out in PAL territories on the 8th (10th) of June.
Is that out?  Shows what I don't know.
Okay, I'm usually one of the patient ones but seriously, I still cannot, for the love of me, connect to any of my accounts. :(
You won't be able to. The entire Far East is still down, until Sony can prove to the Japanese government that the network is secure. They'll announce in the media once it's up again.

And it doesn't end:

http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2011-05-18-sonys-psn-password-page-hacked

"Eurogamer has seen video evidence that verifies reports that Sony's PlayStation Network password reset system suffers from an exploit that allows attackers to change your password using only your PSN account email and your date of birth – information compromised in the PSN hack of 20th April."

@ZAnimus But I also have SA and US accounts. And none of them are working. These area all accounts created on this PS3. I guess, even though you connect to other regions' PSNs, you still go through the local servers (which are still down). :P
Yes, just so.
Store should relaunch on Tuesday: http://www.joystiq.com/2011/05/19/playstation-store-expected-back-online-next-tuesday/

Another day, another Sony hack:

http://arstechnica.com/security/news/2011/05/sony-hacked-again-used-to-host-phishing-site.ars

Lalalalala.

http://blogs.forbes.com/parmyolson/2011/05/23/sony-greek-website-is-latest-to-be-hacked/
An old friend of mine who's still working in network security has been keeping score:  He counts NINE individual incidents now where Sony's security has been penetrated.
Damnit, V, when I saw this thread had been updated I assumed it was to say that the Store was back up :P
Japan (and consequently TW, HK, etc) are still not online. It's been way more than a month... ;(

http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2011-05-24-psn-essential-maintenance-this-evening

Not back today then.
Also, the Store's not back today or tomorrow either. Goddamnit.
And over the weekend my laptop's graphics chip blew. Luckily it's a removable MXM card, so it can be replace. Depressing time for me. :( No PSN, no PC.
It only took more than a month, but @Jevous & co will finally be able to play online again from tomorrow: http://www.next-gen.biz/news/psn-asian-return-nears
@ZAnimus Cancelled all plans for the weekend! Stocking up on Cheetos and Coke Zero. Online madness to follow. See you guys Monday...ish.
Well, they kinda have to right? If they stand in front of all those journalists next week with feathers up their butt... they might really end up being a chicken.

So the Store and all other, still-outstanding services will be back online "by the end of this week", with the exceptions of Japan, Hong Kong and South Korea (those last two still have no PSN whatsoever).

http://www.sony.net/SonyInfo/News/Press/201105/11-0531E/index.html
(oops, wrong thread)

I don't want to get my hopes up yet again, BUT there's scheduled PSN maintenance from 18:30 tonight, ending around 09:00 tomorrow. And apparently some dev posted on its Facebook page that its PSN game will be available on Friday...
The Store is back up! inFamous 2 is downloading RIGHT NOW!!!

It's still quite unstable, though. Everything -- from signing in to entering a code to activating a download -- seems to generate errors the first few times and will only work on the fourth or fifth try.
Here we go AGAIN:  http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-13636704
Ugh, trust it to be before the only long weekend we're having, of which I will spend the entire time away. (granted, it will be spent scuba diving and chilling on the beach, so not all bad i guess)
The free games are available now.
And all the cables in my area was stolen last night, great timing!
So I got the Wipeout collection off the TW store, Stardust and Dead Nation, Killzone Liberation and Persuit Force off the US store and I still have my SA and JP accounts to raid. :)
